title: US intercepts oil tanker off Venezuelan coast, officials say
byline: The United States has intercepted an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela in international waters, U.S. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem confirmed Saturday, a move that comes just days after U.S. President Donald Trump announced a “blockade” of all sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Eastern, Uva and Central provinces and in Polonnaruwa and Hambantota districts, today (21), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: India’s Foreign Minister Jaishankar to visit Sri Lanka amid ongoing recovery from deadly Cyclone Ditwah
byline: India’s External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is set to visit Sri Lanka next week, a trip coming at a time when Delhi immediately reached out to its neighbour amid ongoing recovery from one of the country’s worst natural disasters in decades.

title: Four including woman killed in separate road accidents across several areas
byline: Four people, including a woman, have died in separate road accidents reported from several areas within the past 24 hours, police said.

title: ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’ ignites to $36.5 million on opening day
byline: “Fire and Ash,” the third installment in Disney’s sci-fi saga, grossed $36.5 million from 3,800 North American theaters on Friday.

title: 36 major reservoirs continue to spill – Irrigation Department
byline: The Department of Irrigation stated that out of the 73 major reservoirs under its control, 36 reservoirs are currently spilling.

title: 21-year-old arrested at BIA while attempting to smuggle foreign cigarettes worth Rs. 6.3 mln
byline: A Sri Lankan national has been arrested for attempting to smuggle a consignment of foreign-made cigarettes worth Rs. 6.3 million into the country at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) by officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) this morning (21).

title: India’s Foreign Minister Jaishankar to visit Sri Lanka
byline: India’s External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is set to visit Sri Lanka next week, a trip coming at a time when Delhi immediately reached out to its neighbour amid ongoing recovery from one of the country’s worst natural disasters in decades.

title: Over 500,000 displaced in Cambodia by Thai border clashes: Interior ministry
byline: More than half a million people in Cambodia have been displaced from their homes by two weeks of deadly border clashes with neighbouring Thailand, Phnom Penh’s interior ministry said Sunday (Dec 21).

title: Nine people killed in mass shooting near Johannesburg, South Africa
byline: At least nine people were killed and 10 others wounded when unknown gunmen opened fire at a tavern in a township near Johannesburg early on Sunday, in the latest mass shooting to shock South Africa.

title: Special discussion held to minimize year-end container handling congestion
byline: A discussion has been held with the aim of taking urgent measures to minimize congestion in container handling, export, import and transshipment operations, which typically increase during the year-end period.

title: Top economists call for halt to Sri Lanka debt repayments after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: A group of the world’s top economists including the Nobel prize winner Joseph Stiglitz have called for Sri Lanka’s debt payments to be suspended as it tackles the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Man arrested with large quantity of ICE in Karandeniya
byline: An individual has been apprehended with a large quantity of crystal methamphetamine (‘Ice) in Karandeniya, police stated.

title: Trump set to expand immigration crackdown in 2026 despite brewing backlash
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump is preparing for a more aggressive immigration crackdown in 2026 with billions in new funding, including by raiding more workplaces even as backlash builds ahead of next year’s midterm elections.

title: Five arrested in Jaffna for defying court order granted bail
byline: Five individuals who were arrested in connection with the tense situation that arose opposite the Tissa Rajamaha Viharaya in Jaffna have been granted bail.

title: Decline in air quality observed in several areas: CEA
byline: A decline in air quality has been observed in recent days, with air quality index (AQI) levels increasing, particularly in the Northern, North Central, North Western, and Western Provinces, according to Media Spokesman of the Central Environmental Authority (CEA) Dr. Ajith Gunawardena.

title: AustraliaPM announces intelligence review as country mourns Bondi attack
byline: Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced a review into the police and national intelligence agencies after last weekend’s Bondi Beach attack.

title: Govt plans to relocate schools in landslide-prone areas: PM Harini
byline: Reopening schools located in landslide-prone areas would be extremely dangerous and therefore the government is focusing on identifying such schools and relocating them to suitable locations based on scientific assessments, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has stated.

title: UN envoy commends international support for Sri Lanka following Cyclone Ditwah
byline: A meeting between Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya and the United Nations Resident Coordinator in Sri Lanka, Marc-Andreé Franche, was held on the 20 December 2025 at the Prime Minister’s Office.

title: Academic activities at several faculties of Peradeniya Uni to resume on Dec. 29
byline: Academic activities of six faculties of the University of Peradeniya will fully resume on December 29, the Vice-Chancellor of the University, Professor Terrence Madhujith confirmed.

title: President commends Sri Lanka Army for its unwavering service to the nation
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has commended the Sri Lanka Army for its unwavering service to the nation and people during times of difficulty.

title: Mother and son killed in fatal accident in Galgamuwa
byline: A three-wheeler that was transporting an injured person to hospital met with an accident this afternoon (21) along the Anuradhapura–Padeniya main road in Kurundankulama, Galgamuwa.

title: Family members plea for help to locate missing vessel with five fishermen onboard
byline: A multi-day fishing trawler has gone missing after setting out from the Mirissa fishing harbor in Matara.

title: Special Operations Room at Army Headquarters to ensure public safety during festive season
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Defence, Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd) has directed the activation of a special Operations Room at the Army Headquarters to ensure public safety and security during the ongoing festive season.

title: Google and Apple warn visa workers against overseas travel amid US immigration crackdown
byline: Google and Apple advised US-based employees on work visas not to travel internationally after their outside counsel warned of delays of up to 12 months at US embassies and consulates worldwide amid the immigration crackdown, documents reviewed by Business Insider show.

title: Expectant mother arrested for packaging and selling illicit liquor to long-distance bus employees
byline: An expectant mother allegedly involved in the packaging of illicit liquor and sales operation targeting long-distance bus service employees has been arrested by the Wennappuwa Police.

title: NBRO conducts landslide risk assessment at 120 schools in Central Province
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has conducted landslide risk assessment at 120 schools in the Central Province.

title: Rights groups condemn new record number of executions in Saudi Arabia
byline: Saudi Arabia has surpassed its record for the number of executions carried out annually for a second year in a row.

title: Police officer alleges assault by NPP MP Shantha Pathma Kumara following cannabis raid
byline: A police officer attached to the Sooriyakanda Police Station has alleged that he was assaulted by a group including Ratnapura District National People’s Power (NPP) Member of Parliament Shantha Pathma Kumara Subasingha while returning home after completing his duty.

title: Rail services between Anuradhapura and Kankesanthurai to recommence tomorrow
byline: Rail services along the Northern Railway Line between Kankesanthurai and Anuradhapura are scheduled to recommence tomorrow (22).

title: Fire at Thihariya three-storey building brought under control
byline: The fire that broke out this afternoon (21) within a three-storey building in Thihariya, Nittambuwa along the Colombo–Kandy main road has now been fully brought under control.

title: Imran Khan calls for protests in Pakistan after 17-year jail sentence
byline: Pakistan’s former Prime Minister Imran Khan urged his supporters to gear up for countrywide protests following a 17-year jail term handed to him and wife Bushra Bibi in a corruption case.

title: Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith criticises education reforms that strips parents of their rights
byline: The present government is moving forward with education reforms that strips parents of their rights, according to Archbishop of Colombo His Eminence Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith states.

title: Spills gates of 12 major reservoirs closed after water levels recede
byline: Spill gates of 12 major reservoirs have been closed completely while overall, release of water from reservoirs across the country are currently decreasing, Eng. Nilantha Danapala, the Director of the Water Management Secretariat at the Mahaweli Authority of Sri Lanka has confirmed.

title: Officers withdraw from disaster relief operations in Kalpitiya due to threats and attacks
byline: Government officers attached to the Kalpitiya Divisional Secretariat have temporarily withdrawn from disaster relief distribution activities.
